timeSeries.long_name: unique identifier for each feature instance

WPFM.long_name: sea surface wave spectral mean period

WPPE.comment: Period of the peak of the energy spectrum

SSWMD.long_name: spectral sea surface wave mean direction
SSWMD.comment: Direction (related to the magnetic north) from which the mean period waves are coming from

WPDI.comment: Direction (related to the magnetic north) from which the peak period waves are coming from

WMDS.long_name: spectral sea surface wave mean directional spread

WPDS.long_name: spectral sea surface wave peak directional spread

WSSH.long_name: sea surface wave spectral significant height

WAVE_quality_control.long_name: primary Quality Control flag for wave variables
WAVE_quality_control.quality_control_convention: Ocean Data Standards, UNESCO 2013 - IOC Manuals and Guides, 54, Volume 3 Version 1

abstract: Near real-time in-situ wave data from shallow coastal waters (<35 m depth) along the NSW coast collected by temporary wave buoys deployed on moorings.
acknowledgement: Any users of data are required to clearly acknowledge the source of the material in the format: \"NSW wave data sourced from IMOS were collected, processed and provided by the NSW Nearshore Wave Data Program operated by the NSW Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water\". For more information visit: https://datasets.seed.nsw.gov.au/dataset/nsw-nearshore-wave-buoy-parameter-time-series-data-completed-deployments. This dataset is an output from the Catching Oz Waves project, which received investment (https://doi.org/10.47486/DP748) from the Australian Research Data Commons (ARDC). The ARDC is funded by the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS). Data was sourced from Australia\â€™s Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS) - IMOS is enabled by the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS).\"
citation: The citation to be used in publications using the dataset should follow the format: "Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (DCCEEW), New South Wales Government [year-of-data-downloaded], Wave Buoys Observations - Australia - near real time, Downloaded from [url] on [date-of-download]."
author: AODN
disclaimer: Data, products and services from NSW DCCEEW are provided \"as is\" without any warranty as to fitness for a particular purpose.
references: Kinsela, M.A., Morris, B.D., Ingleton, T.C., et al. Nearshore wave buoy data from southeastern Australia for coastal research and management. Sci. Data 11, 190 (2024). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-023-02865-x
standard_name_vocabulary: NetCDF Climate and Forecast CF Standard Name Table Version 78
